str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From prophetes; to foretell events, divine, speak under inspiration, exercise the prophetic office.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From the primary kapto; the head, literally or figuratively.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and aischunomai; to shame down, i.e. Disgrace or put to the blush.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the primary kapto; the head, literally or figuratively.
